title: Coca-Cola India Enables Hydration Access and Retail Empowerment at Asia's Largest Tribal Festival
summary: Coca-Cola India is supporting Medaram Jatara 2026, Asia's largest tribal festival, by providing extensive hydration access, empowering local retailers, and implementing community-led waste management initiatives. Through its 'Locally Yours' program, the company is creating economic opportunities for local communities and ensuring seamless refreshment availability for millions of pilgrims, while also promoting responsible waste disposal and the reuse of plastic waste.

title: Refresh Your Closet with the Coca‑Cola® x adidas Collection
summary: Coca-Cola and Adidas are collaborating on a new collection featuring several footwear styles like the Samba, Superstar, F50, Predator, and Adilette Slides, set to release in Summer 2026. The collection incorporates special graphics, branding elements, and ruby-colored accents. This partnership is timed with the upcoming FIFA World Cup, recalling their previous collaboration during the 2002 World Cup.

title: Innovation Beverage Group Ltd Announces Five-for-One Reverse Stock Split Effective January 30, 2026
summary: Innovation Beverage Group Ltd (IBG) has announced a five-for-one reverse stock split, effective January 30, 2026, which will reduce its outstanding ordinary shares from 3,470,331 to 694,066. The company's shares will continue to trade on The Nasdaq Capital Market under the symbol "IBG." This move aims to increase the stock's market price, potentially attracting more institutional investors, while the company maintains its focus on premium beverage brands and its partnership with Coca-Cola Europacific Partners.

title: Hokkaido Coca-Cola Bottling Co. Faces Evaluation Adjustment Amid Mixed Financial Signals
summary: Hokkaido Coca-Cola Bottling Co., a small-cap beverages company, has undergone an evaluation adjustment due to changes in its financial metrics. The company shows a mixed technical outlook with a sideways trend, low management efficiency (ROE 2.49%), and constrained long-term growth in net sales (0.42%) and operating profit (2.22%). Despite this, it maintains a low debt profile and sufficient cash reserves.

title: Coca-Cola Captures 'All the Feels' of Soccer Fans for World Cup 2026
summary: Coca-Cola has launched "All the Feels," a global campaign for the upcoming FIFA World Cup 2026, marking its 12th tournament as an official partner. The campaign aims to connect with soccer fans' emotional journey, from anticipation to heartbreak, positioning Coke as a constant companion. It features TV spots, including "Bubbling Up" with a new World Cup anthem cover by J Balvin, and will include digital activations, a Panini partnership, and the FIFA World Cup 2026 Trophy Tour.

title: Beyond Meat’s protein soda might be its last chance and best hope
summary: Beyond Meat is launching a new protein soda called Beyond Immerse, which marks a significant departure from its traditional meat-alternative products. This pivot comes as the company faces declining sales and financial struggles in the plant-based meat market. The protein soda, offered in fruity flavors with impressive nutritional macros, targets the rapidly growing functional drinks market, which Beyond Meat hopes will provide a much-needed path to profitability and allow it more time to turn its fortunes around.

title: Slideshow: Functional formulation innovations
summary: Consumer packaged goods companies are enhancing products with functional ingredients like protein, energy, and probiotics. Innovations include Genius Gourmet's protein puffs, Kellanova's RXBAR protein energy bites, and Lifeway Foods' probiotic kefir butter, catering to consumer demand for healthier, convenient, and functional food options. These new offerings highlight a trend towards incorporating benefits beyond basic nutrition into everyday snacks and ingredients.

title: FIFA WORLD CUP™ TROPHY TOUR BY COCA-COLA TO ARRIVE IN CANADA
summary: The FIFA World Cup™ Trophy Tour by Coca-Cola will visit Canada between April 9 and May 26, 2026, offering fans in seven cities the chance to see the original FIFA World Cup Trophy. This tour, marking its 20th anniversary, is part of the lead-up to the FIFA World Cup 2026 across Canada, Mexico, and the United States, promising interactive experiences and promoting positive community impact. Fans can register for tickets starting January 29, 2026, to witness football's most desired prize.

title: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Downgrades Coca Cola Femsa (NYSE:KOF) to Neutral
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has downgraded Coca Cola Femsa (NYSE:KOF) from an "overweight" to a "neutral" rating, setting a $100 price target, which implies an 8.16% downside. Despite this, other analysts have recently upgraded the stock, leading to a mixed overall analyst view with an average "Moderate Buy" rating and a $103.00 average target price. KOF shares opened at $108.88, near their 52-week high, and the company has a market cap of $177.80 billion.

title: Coca-Cola Stock: Analyst Estimates & Ratings
summary: The Coca-Cola Company (KO) has slightly underperformed the broader market but shown resilience as a defensive stock. Analysts largely recommend a "Strong Buy" for KO, expecting EPS growth of 3.8% in FY2025, with a mean price target suggesting a nearly 10% upside potential. The company's strong brand portfolio, global presence, and pricing power contribute to its stability amidst economic headwinds.

title: Coca-Cola captures football’s emotional highs and lows in FIFA World Cup 2026 campaign
summary: Coca-Cola has launched its global FIFA World Cup 2026 campaign, focusing on the emotional highs and lows of football. The campaign, which includes films, digital activations, and a new anthem reimagining Van Halen's "Jump," aims to connect with fans through shared experiences. Coca-Cola is also partnering with football figures and Panini for a sticker collection, emphasizing its role as a constant companion throughout the tournament.

title: 3 Consumer Dividend Stocks for Investors Seeking Steady Income: Costco, Coca-Cola, and Altria
summary: This article highlights three consumer dividend stocks—Costco Wholesale, Coca-Cola, and Altria Group—as reliable options for investors seeking steady income. It details Costco's subscription-based model and dividend growth potential, Coca-Cola's status as a Dividend King with global brand recognition, and Altria's strong dividend yield sustained by pricing power despite declining tobacco sales. The author emphasizes that these companies offer different investment styles but all provide consistent dividend payments.

title: Pay Less, Gain More: KDP Tops PepsiCo Stock
summary: This article argues that Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) stock is a better investment than PepsiCo (PEP) stock. KDP has a lower valuation (P/OpInc) but demonstrates higher revenue and operating income growth compared to PepsiCo, suggesting a potential disconnect between valuation and performance. The analysis highlights that this trend of KDP outperforming PEP in growth metrics has been persistent over the last year.

title: 3 Consumer Dividend Stocks for Investors Seeking Steady Income: Costco, Coca-Cola, and Altria
summary: This article highlights three consumer dividend stocks—Costco Wholesale, Coca-Cola, and Altria Group—as reliable choices for investors seeking steady income. It details each company's strengths, such as Costco's membership model and special dividends, Coca-Cola's global reach and Dividend King status, and Altria's pricing power enabling a high dividend yield despite declining cigarette sales. The piece emphasizes the benefits of dividend stocks for long-term investors.

title: J Balvin, Amber Mark, Travis Barker, Steve Vai Collab On Coca-Cola Anthem For FIFA World Cup 2026
summary: Coca-Cola has launched a new global campaign for the FIFA World Cup 2026, continuing its nearly five-decade partnership with FIFA. The campaign features an anthem titled "Bubbling Up" with J Balvin, Amber Mark, Steve Vai, and Travis Barker, which reimagines Van Halen's "Jump." It aims to connect fans through the emotional highs and lows of the World Cup, with additional films, digital activations, and a Trophy Tour planned.

title: CocaCola (NYSE:KO) Trading 1.3% Higher - What's Next?
summary: Coca-Cola (NYSE:KO) shares rose 1.3% to $73.53 on Tuesday, with mid-day trading volume down 27% from the average. Analysts maintain a consensus "Buy" rating with a mean price target of $79.08, following several target increases from firms like Bank of America and UBS. Despite positive analyst sentiment, company insiders have been net sellers in the past 90 days, with executives Manuel Arroyo and Nancy Quan selling a significant number of shares.

title: Coca-Cola Reshapes Leadership To Link Digital Strategy And Global Growth
summary: Coca-Cola has announced a significant executive leadership restructuring, including the appointment of Henrique Braun as CEO and the creation of a new Chief Digital Officer role. This overhaul aims to better integrate digital strategy with global growth initiatives, particularly focusing on emerging markets like India. Investors will be monitoring how these changes impact digital key performance indicators, bottler performance, and the planned IPO of its Indian bottling arm.

title: PepsiCo Leans on Pricing Power: Is Volume Decline a Growing Risk?
summary: PepsiCo has increasingly relied on pricing to drive revenue growth, offsetting rising input costs and protecting margins, especially in North America. While this strategy has supported profitability, it raises concerns about potential volume declines as consumers become more price-sensitive. Competitors like Coca-Cola and Keurig Dr Pepper also employ similar pricing strategies, highlighting a broader industry trend where balancing price realization with affordability is crucial for long-term volume stability.

title: PepsiCo Leans on Pricing Power: Is Volume Decline a Growing Risk?
summary: PepsiCo has increasingly relied on pricing to drive revenue growth, which has helped offset rising input costs and protect margins despite shifting demand. While effective for the top line, this strategy raises concerns about potential volume declines, especially in North America, as consumers become more price-sensitive. Competitors like Coca-Cola and Keurig Dr Pepper are also navigating this balance, emphasizing affordability alongside price increases to maintain demand.

title: PepsiCo Leans on Pricing Power: Is Volume Decline a Growing Risk?
summary: PepsiCo has increasingly relied on pricing to drive revenue growth, offsetting rising input costs and protecting margins, but this strategy has raised concerns about potential volume decline, especially in North America. Other beverage companies like Coca-Cola and Keurig Dr Pepper are also using pricing to protect revenues and margins. PepsiCo is working to balance pricing power with affordability through various initiatives to mitigate the risk of falling volumes and maintain market share.

title: Is Volume Growth the Next Real Test for Coca-Cola's Strategy?
summary: Coca-Cola (KO) is facing lower volumes in key markets due to consumer strain, but aims for balanced top-line growth and volume expansion through premiumization, affordability initiatives, and strategic pricing. The company expects pricing to normalize as inflation eases and anticipates strong volume growth from the Asia Pacific region. Competitors like PepsiCo (PEP) and Monster Beverage (MNST) also focus on value leadership, innovation, and strategic pricing to maintain market share.

title: Coca-Cola Puts Fan Emotions First in FIFA World Cup 2026™ Campaign
summary: Coca-Cola has launched its global campaign for the FIFA World Cup 2026™, focusing on the emotional experience of football fans. The campaign, building on nearly five decades of partnership with FIFA, kicks off with the film "Bubbling Up" and features a new anthem with global artists, a reimagined version of Van Halen's "Jump." It includes digital and on-the-ground activations like the FIFA World Cup™ Trophy Tour and a partnership with Panini for a custom sticker collection.

title: YUM Stock Today: January 27 KFC Eyes Cornwall Drive-Thru Expansion
summary: Yum Brands' stock (YUM) is under scrutiny after KFC announced plans for a new drive-thru in Saltash, Cornwall, alongside a Costa Coffee, signaling steady UK expansion. While a single site won't significantly impact earnings, it indicates healthy growth and strong market demand. Investors are watching the planning approval process and YUM's upcoming February 4th earnings call for insights into UK development targets and drive-thru performance, as well as Coca-Cola (KO) regarding the Costa Coffee segment.

title: Argus raises Monster Beverage stock price target to $95 on growth outlook
summary: Argus has raised its price target for Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) to $95.00 from $90.00, maintaining a Buy rating due to strong domestic and international growth potential. The firm highlighted Monster's impressive five-year compound annual sales and EPS growth rates of 13%-15%, a clean balance sheet, and a focus on the rapidly expanding energy drink segment. Other analysts from Morgan Stanley, Stifel, Piper Sandler, and Wells Fargo have also recently increased their price targets for Monster, reinforcing a positive outlook for the company.

title: Splash Beverage Group Announces Senor Frog's Selection of Chispo(R) Tequila as Its House Tequila Across Multiple US and Caribbean Markets
summary: Splash Beverage Group, Inc. announced that Senor Frog's, an international restaurant and entertainment brand, has selected Chispo® Tequila as its house tequila for initial locations in Florida, the Bahamas, and Mexico. This partnership marks Chispo's first high-profile national hospitality partner, validating its brand positioning and quality. The collaboration is expected to significantly increase Chispo's visibility and trial among Senor Frog's guests and could expand to other Grupo Anderson’s restaurant concepts.

title: Union Pacific (NYSE:UNP) Posts Q4 CY2025 Sales In Line With Estimates
summary: Union Pacific (NYSE:UNP) reported Q4 CY2025 sales of $6.09 billion, flat year-on-year and slightly below analyst estimates. While its non-GAAP profit of $2.86 per share was in line with expectations, the company experienced a decrease in operating margin. The article details Union Pacific's revenue growth, operating margin, and EPS trends, highlighting recent challenges in the rail transportation sector.

title: LendingClub (LC) Reports Q4: Everything You Need To Know Ahead Of Earnings
summary: LendingClub (NYSE:LC) is preparing to report its Q4 earnings after market hours this Wednesday. Analysts expect a 20.6% year-on-year revenue growth to $261.9 million and adjusted earnings of $0.35 per share. The company has a history of consistently beating revenue estimates and is heading into earnings with a 7.7% share price increase over the last month and an average analyst price target of $23.82.

title: Annaly Capital Management (NLY) Q4 Earnings: What To Expect
summary: Annaly Capital Management (NLY) is set to release its Q4 earnings, with analysts expecting a 38.4% year-on-year revenue growth to $729.8 million and adjusted earnings of $0.73 per share. The company beat revenue expectations last quarter but missed net interest income estimates. Investor sentiment in the banks segment has been positive, and Annaly Capital Management is trading near its average analyst price target.

title: AXIS Capital (AXS) Q4 Results: What You Should Know
summary: AXIS Capital (AXS) is set to release its Q4 earnings report, with analysts expecting a 6.9% year-over-year revenue increase to $1.69 billion and adjusted earnings per share of $3.12. Despite recent stock declines and broader sector lag, AXIS Capital previously matched revenue projections and surpassed EPS and book value expectations in the last quarter. Investors are watching for consistency, as the company has missed Wall Street's revenue expectations in six of the past two years.

title: The Coca-Cola Company has hinted that it may launch products that add protein or dietary fiber to Co..
summary: The Coca-Cola Company is considering launching products with added protein or dietary fiber to align with consumer health trends, as stated by CEO James Quincey. This move signifies a shift in the soft drink market beyond just reducing sugar and calories. However, experts like Dr. Michael Edney are skeptical, labeling such products as "functional junk food" and questioning their true health benefits.

title: Coca-Cola hints at reinventing soda, starting with your favorite drinks
summary: Coca-Cola CEO James Quincey suggested that popular soft drinks might soon include added protein or fiber to appeal to evolving consumer preferences. While the company already sells fiber-enhanced Diet Coke in Japan, a doctor interviewed described such products as "functional junk food," cautioning that added nutrients don't necessarily make highly processed beverages healthy. This move comes as protein continues to be a major consumer trend, as seen with Starbucks' recent protein-enhanced lattes.

title: How Investors Are Reacting To Coca-Cola (KO) Leadership Shake-Up And Scrapped Costa Coffee Sale
summary: Coca-Cola recently announced a leadership reshuffle, including a new CEO and Chief Digital Officer role, and halted the sale of Costa Coffee as bids fell short. These moves signal a focus on tighter portfolio management and integrating digital capabilities. While the company's investment narrative remains centered on steady growth and dividends, these strategic adjustments aim to sharpen execution and modernize operations, with investors keenly watching upcoming earnings and the company’s ability to maintain pricing power and margins.

title: Lbp Am Sa Takes Position in PepsiCo, Inc. $PEP
summary: Lbp Am Sa acquired a new stake of 179,392 shares in PepsiCo, valued at approximately $25.19 million, in the third quarter. Institutional investors now own about 73.07% of the company's stock. While analysts have issued mixed ratings, with some upgrades, the MarketBeat consensus is a "Hold" with a $159.29 price target, amid news like Coca-Cola reclaiming Costco food courts and PepsiCo's 3.9% dividend yield coupled with a high payout ratio.

title: Lbp Am Sa Acquires 93,997 Shares of Fomento Economico Mexicano S.A.B. de C.V. $FMX
summary: Lbp Am Sa increased its stake in Fomento Economico Mexicano S.A.B. de C.V. (FMX) by 22.1%, acquiring 93,997 additional shares, bringing its total to 518,532 shares valued at approximately $51.14 million. The company's stock, FMX, recently missed its quarterly EPS estimates but increased its quarterly dividend to $2.0531, resulting in an annualized dividend of $8.21 and a 7.7% yield. Analysts generally hold a "Hold" rating for FMX, with an average price target of $101.63.

title: Mutual of America Capital Management LLC Sells 8,839 Shares of PepsiCo, Inc. $PEP
summary: Mutual of America Capital Management LLC reduced its stake in PepsiCo, Inc. by 5.6% in the third quarter, selling 8,839 shares and retaining 148,452 shares valued at approximately $20.85 million. The article also highlights PepsiCo's dividend information, recent news affecting the company (including distribution loss at Costco), and analyst ratings, which currently average a "Hold" with a consensus price target of $159.29.

title: Why BellRing Brands (BRBR) Shares Are Trading Lower Today
summary: Shares of BellRing Brands (BRBR) fell 7.5% after Deutsche Bank lowered its price target on the stock from $35 to $31, citing a potentially challenging quarter and lower-than-expected trends for its Premier Protein product line. This comes despite a recent surge in the stock, driven by comments from Coca-Cola's CEO highlighting increased consumer demand for protein-enriched beverages, which positively impacted investor sentiment for the entire sector including BellRing Brands. The company's shares are down 2.5% year-to-date and are trading significantly below their 52-week high.

title: Strs Ohio Lowers Position in Monster Beverage Corporation $MNST
summary: Strs Ohio has reduced its stake in Monster Beverage Corporation (NASDAQ:MNST) by 18.4% in the third quarter, selling over 37,000 shares. Despite this, other institutional investors have increased their positions in the company. Analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for Monster Beverage, with an average price target of $76.62.

title: Packaging Corporation of America (PKG) To Report Earnings Tomorrow: Here Is What To Expect
summary: Packaging Corporation of America (PKG) is set to report its earnings on Tuesday after the bell. Analysts forecast a 13.5% year-on-year revenue increase to $2.44 billion and adjusted earnings of $2.41 per share, with estimates largely reconfirmed over the past month. The company has missed revenue estimates twice in the last two years, but investor sentiment in the industrials segment has been positive, with PKG's stock up 8% in the last month.

title: PepsiCo, Inc. $PEP Shares Sold by Cullen Frost Bankers Inc.
summary: Cullen Frost Bankers Inc. reduced its stake in PepsiCo (NASDAQ:PEP) by 7.0%, selling 7,467 shares and now holding 98,770 shares valued at $13.87 million. Analysts have a "Hold" consensus rating with an average target price of $159.29, despite recent distribution setbacks like losing Costco food courts to Coca-Cola. The company continues to pay a quarterly dividend of $1.4225, with a payout ratio of 108.17%.

title: Callahan Advisors LLC Buys 7,399 Shares of PepsiCo, Inc. $PEP
summary: Callahan Advisors LLC increased its stake in PepsiCo, Inc. (NASDAQ:PEP) by 5.7% during the 3rd quarter, purchasing an additional 7,399 shares to bring its total holdings to 137,913 shares valued at approximately $19.37 million. This investment makes PepsiCo the 15th largest position in Callahan Advisors LLC's portfolio, representing about 1.6% of its total holdings. While analyst ratings are mixed, with a consensus "Hold" rating and a target price of $159.29, PepsiCo continues to pay a quarterly dividend of $1.4225, yielding 3.9%.

title: Warren Buffett Was Never Just a Value Investor. Here’s the Real Secret to His Investing Success
summary: A new research paper by Kai Wu challenges the conventional wisdom that Warren Buffett is purely a value investor, revealing that only 8% of his top holdings traded below book value. Instead, Buffett has systematically paid premiums for quality businesses with strong intangible assets through three distinct eras: industrial, consumer, and information. The research indicates that 87% of Buffett's outperformance can be explained by two factors—intangible value and quality—suggesting that a systematic, factor-based approach can replicate his success.

title: PepsiCo, Inc. $PEP Shares Sold by AEGON ASSET MANAGEMENT UK Plc
summary: AEGON ASSET MANAGEMENT UK Plc reduced its stake in PepsiCo, Inc. by 24.1% in the third quarter of 2025, selling 98,539 shares. Despite this, some analysts have upgraded PepsiCo's stock and increased price targets, though the MarketBeat consensus remains a 'Hold' with a $159.29 target. The article also highlights PepsiCo's dividend, which yields 3.9%, and recent analyst upgrades, as well as competitive considerations like Coca-Cola reclaiming Costco food courts.

title: The Truth About International Flavors & Fragrances: Hidden Giant Or Silent Flop For Your Money?
summary: International Flavors & Fragrances (IFF) is often overlooked despite its significant role in the food, beverage, and personal care industries. The company's stock has recently seen an uptick, leading to questions about whether it's a hidden gem or a value trap. While not a trendy "meme stock," IFF is a crucial behind-the-scenes player undergoing a restructuring effort, positioning it as a potential long-term investment for those willing to tolerate risk and a slower return.

title: UMB Financial (UMBF) Q4 Earnings Report Preview: What To Look For
summary: UMB Financial (UMBF) is set to announce its Q4 earnings results. Analysts anticipate revenue growth of 56.6% year-on-year to $679.9 million and adjusted earnings of $2.70 per share, maintaining consistent estimates. The company has a strong record of exceeding revenue expectations and momentum from positive investor sentiment in the regional banking sector.

title: IYK vs. PBJ: Blue-Chip Stability or Concentrated Food Bets?
summary: This article compares two ETFs, Invesco Food & Beverage ETF (PBJ) and iShares US Consumer Staples ETF (IYK), highlighting their differences in cost, dividend yield, and sector breadth. IYK offers broader exposure to consumer staples, including healthcare, a lower expense ratio, and higher dividend yield, while PBJ is more concentrated in food and beverage companies. IYK has shown stronger recent performance, suggesting it might be a more stable choice for defensive investing, whereas PBJ is suited for investors with specific conviction in the food and beverage sector.

title: Whittier Trust Co. Decreases Position in PepsiCo, Inc. $PEP
summary: Whittier Trust Co. reduced its stake in PepsiCo by 6.5% during Q3 2025, now owning 103,122 shares valued at $14.64 million. Despite varied analyst opinions, the consensus rating is "Hold" with a target price of $159.29. PepsiCo recently issued a quarterly dividend of $1.4225 per share, but faces a significant distribution setback after Coca-Cola regained exclusive rights to U.S. Costco food courts.

title: Coca-Cola Resets Leadership And Digital Focus While Retaining Costa Coffee
summary: Coca-Cola announced a significant leadership restructuring, including the creation of a Chief Digital Officer role, to spearhead a digital transformation. The company also decided against selling Costa Coffee after bids failed to meet expectations, signaling a strategic reassessment of its portfolio. These changes indicate Coca-Cola's intent to centralize digital capabilities and reconsider its asset management.

title: Mitsubishi UFJ Trust & Banking Corp Has $64.99 Million Stock Holdings in Monster Beverage Corporation $MNST
summary: Mitsubishi UFJ Trust & Banking Corp significantly reduced its stake in Monster Beverage Corporation (NASDAQ:MNST) by 6.1% in the third quarter, now holding shares valued at $64.99 million. Despite this, institutional investors collectively own 72.36% of the company's stock. The article also highlights recent insider selling activity, positive Q3 earnings that beat analyst expectations, and a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts with an average price target of $76.62.

title: Resona Asset Management Co. Ltd. Sells 23,587 Shares of Altria Group, Inc. $MO
summary: Resona Asset Management Co. Ltd. reduced its stake in Altria Group, Inc. by 4.3% in the third quarter of 2025, selling 23,587 shares and retaining 526,963 shares valued at approximately $34.78 million. Altria Group has a $2.0 billion share buyback program authorized and offers a significant annual dividend of $4.24, yielding around 6.8%. The company recently beat EPS estimates and analysts currently rate the stock as "Hold" with a consensus price target of $62.56.

title: Commerzbank Aktiengesellschaft FI Boosts Holdings in Monster Beverage Corporation $MNST
summary: Commerzbank Aktiengesellschaft FI significantly increased its stake in Monster Beverage Corporation ($MNST) by 76.3% in Q3, acquiring an additional 52,453 shares to hold a total of 121,167 shares valued at $8.16 million. Despite this institutional accumulation, the article notes recent insider selling by Emelie Tirre and Rodney C. Sacks, totaling $20.14 million over the past 90 days. Monster Beverage reported strong Q3 earnings, surpassing revenue and EPS estimates, and holds a "Moderate Buy" analyst rating with an average target price of $76.62.
